column4: hi, i installed ubuntu on my laptop and sound does not work (snd-hda-intel) what can I do?
sudo modprobe snd-hda-intel'
run that command in a terminal and then see if you can play sound.
nothing happens,no error, no sound. Volume is max
what kind of sound are you trying to play?
what is the output of 'sudo modprobe -l | grep snd_hda_intel'
internet radio
don't try that, try a wav file or mp3
i tried mp3 and ogg, but totem player hangs
this problem should be fixed soon. it's important you report a bug in that page.
Rhythmbox does not play, too
i don't know what's happening with sound on your system. you'd do well to search in the forums. i see this bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/alsa-driver/+bug/83015
you should add a post to that page
it's numbers that get bugs fixed..
ok thank you
sorry i can't help. many people are having problems with this card in Feisty.
also see this post: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=414827
thank you very much, i'll try!
good for you my friend. be a little patient and all will be well. the Ubuntu devs have to work hard to try to get things working on every configuration.
yes, i can imagine. I was just impressed that nearly everything else worked out of the box, even wlan!
yes there's a high hit rate with this release. still a few rough edges though. with some help from driver developers we'll get there..
yes, I only dicovered one more issue: wake up does not work after suspend to ram. And going to suspend mode takes very long time. But I dont use this normally, so I dont care.
so thank you again, I must reboot ;-)
